Author: ig1
Content:
But that's like saying you can secure a computer by sealing it an concrete box and burying it under the ocean.

Wikileaks triages the data, pushes it out to the media, maintains physical drop-boxes across multiple continents, and much more. All of which requires people doing real work, the storage of data is a tiny part of the problem.

And even for the storage part freenet isn't a real solution. How many journalists do you know who use freenet ? - pushing data into the public domain is useless if only a tiny handful of people have access to it.

Author: blasdel
Content:
Apps that block their own ads? I'm sure Apple wouldn't give a shit. App Store apps are sandboxed, and can't fuck with each other or with the built-in apps.

Apple doesn't sell the iPhone through carriers anywhere without an unlimited data plan. They'll only be changing that with the iPad in a month or so.

Author: blasdel
Content:
I really wish he hadn't used literal zero and one arabic numerals (along with blank) as his tape symbols.

dash and pipe would have been much more evocative of 1-bit information, rather than persisting with this misleading "ones and zeroes" bullshit that has infected popular culture and tends to totally obscure the underlying concept.

Author: jokull
Content:
Don't underestimate how ITERATIVE the design process is. Do something then tweak it, then do it again then tweak it.

Don't think that everything is ruined and hopeless just because you can't get your ideas down right away. Iterate!

Author: ableal
Content:
[... crickets ... a day later, back at the ranch: ]

http://www.reddit.com/r/programming/comments/biv72/why_git_a...

As a game developer, my repository is many gigabytes in size - consisting mostly of binary data. Perforce handles it like a champ; it scales incredibly well, even to the near-ridiculous volumes of data I need to build my projects.

And first hit on a quick search: It is well known that Google uses Perforce as its internal source management system (it has a source license).

So, obviously, it should be prescribed that everybody and his dog use a DVCS good at merging changes on text files, which solves the problem of the subset of people that:

1 - Hop around like rabbits, carrying their copy of the whole repository, and previously had to mail each other patches.

2 - Only work on text files, code with barely any non-text documentation, like top-dog kernel developers.

Good going.

Author: maxklein
Content:
I'm not sure exactly what you're trying to say. I'm openly for the Chinese system of government as I've stated several times in the past. I believe that freedom from poverty, a lack of violence and a massive emphasis on educating people even at the cost of supressing dissedent opinion is far better than the systems being tried in other parts of the world, as these systems have resulted in brutal systems that cause suffering and death everyday.

If you want people to stop suffering, then go save people being executed on the streets everyday in the cities across west africa. Go watch sahara reporters and see the truth about extra-judicial killings. It's documented and available for all to see - you can watch the videos and then make a difference. Saying that china is doing this even though there is no evidence to support this thesis is just a way of keeping the argument abstract - you can blame the country but not have to actually do anything.

I would not ever argue this point if I had not been in all the countries. I've been in China, in the U.S and in Africa. I've seen how the different systems work, and I believe the chinese system is a system that is right in bringing such a huge and diverse country into wealth without devolving into war.

There is no nerve to hit here, this is my open opinion about the issue. I am not anti-american or anti-freedom, it's just my opinion that the chinese system at the moment is the best system for china.

Author: jamii
Title: Ask HN: Introduction to web design?
Content: Can anyone recommend a place to find the absolute basics I need to know to create simple, easy-to-use, cross-browser interfaces? I understand the principles behind html/css/js and I've worked on server-side software. Where I fall down is in taking the design in my head and translating it into an actual page. I would prefer to avoid anything aimed at non-programmers because the signal to noise ratio is maddening.

Author: tjgabbour
Content:
Dean Baker is a good economist, who predicted the housing bubble early on, as well as the resulting recession.\nhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dean_Baker#Financial_crisis_of_...

I think it makes sense that some economists are a lot better at their jobs than others. Many may fall into ideological ruts, because industry and government have strong interests in the outcome of this social "science".
